results.title: The Ingot
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare, Film Producers Guild and Merton Park
results.brief_description: More than 97% of the steel produced in Britain is cast into ingots. The different methods of teeming molten steel into ingot moulds are shown in this film, which also illustrates with sectional diagrams the difference between the main types of ingot and explains the purpose for which each type is generally used.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare, Film Producers Guild and Merton Park

results.title: The Informer
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Cliff Reid and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: John Ford’s motion picture masterpiece is about a dull witted lout who sells out his best friend, an IRA leader, for a twenty pound note, and then is overwhelmed by the consequence of his act. Based on the novel by Liam O’Flaherty. Stars Victor McLaglen.

results.title: The Informative label
results.brief_description: An explanation of how manufacturers test their products and assign ‘facts labels’ giving points to various qualities eg. durability, colour fastness. This enables consumers to compare directly the wares of different manufacturers.
results.description: An explanation of how manufacturers test their products and assign ‘facts labels’ giving points to various qualities eg. durability, colour fastness. This enables consumers to compare directly the wares of different manufacturers.

results.title: The Information machine: or creative man and the data...
results.creator_credit: Ray Eames, Charles Eames and IBM
results.brief_description: Made for the IBM pavilion at the Brussels World’s Fair, it attempts to clearly place the electronic computer in the context of human development, suggesting that it is a logical extension of our desire to connect and relate things. Explains the nature of data processing, beginning with primitive man and ending with the advent of machine simulation. Drawings and animation by Dolores Cannata, music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.title: The Influential Americans
results.creator_credit: Arthur D Morse, Carousel Films and CBS
results.brief_description: A report on bold new experiments in the utilization of above-average teachers. Shows new teaching techniques and experiments. Intended to focus attention on the role of gifted school teachers and some of the methods currently used to solve major educational problems.

results.title: The Infinite voyage
results.creator_credit: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences and WQED
results.brief_description: Focusing on current and compelling scientific topics, this series is a unique visual presentation that inspires students to see their world in new ways and discover how modern technologies contribute to scientific discovery. These programs go beyond the latest technology reports in newspapers, magazines, and television to the personal stories of people at the boundaries of scientific research. A journey to the very brink of scientific exploration where individuals and technology meet the unknown.

results.title: The Infinite Variety
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life on Earth”.
David Attenborough examines the beginnings of life on earth. It took nearly 3,000 million years for life to evolve from the first primitive cells to a single creature such as a jellyfish, and these stages of evolution are traced.

results.title: The Infant mind
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discussion of the theories of Jean Piaget on cognitive development. Interviews with child psychologists who comment on the development of thinking, learning and problem solving.

results.title: The Industrious flame
results.creator_credit: John Miller, Frank Green, British Gas Council and Ace Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates that heat is essential in practically all industries to process raw materials. States that gas is one of the most economical sources of heat and shows its use in the pottery, steel sheet, baking and electric globes industries.
